images.caption: Figure 1:Example comparison of model responses with and without input scrutiny ability. The query contains a false premise about the total number of rings (claiming ”only four rings” while the image shows 8 rings). The response ”Without Input Scrutiny Ability” accepts the flawed premise and generates reasoning based on it, while the response ”With Input Scrutiny Ability” proactively identifies the contradiction between the text and the image, demonstrating active input validation.

Figure 2:Schematic illustration of the dataset construction and evaluation pipeline. (A) The question synthesis pipeline: original questions are rewritten by GPT-4o to implant predefined false premises, followed by filtering by human annotators to ensure quality. (B) Dataset distribution across error types and variants. (C) The evaluation pipeline: model-generated answers are first evaluated by o3 and then verified through manual checks to ensure accurate assessment of input scrutiny ability.
